Compound <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, a chemical used to kill weeds, can affect <math alttext="E P S P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>EPSP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> synthesis by interacting with <math alttext="E P S P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>EPSP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> synthase. Figure 2. In the other half, pollen from <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> plants was used to fertilize ovules in <math alttext="S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> plants.
